data.title: AANA Committees
data.meta_description: Explore AANA committees and discover outstanding opportunities to help your career, peers, and profession.
data.meta_site_name: AANA - American Association of Nurse Anesthesiology
data.text:
"What is one of the benefits of serving on AANA committees? Members engage in discussions, exchange ideas, and collaborate with peers, enhancing their knowledge and skills in the field of nurse anesthesia. AANA Committee service allows CRNAs the opportunity to influence policy decisions, shape educational initiatives, and advocate for the interests of nurse anesthetists on a national level. Serving on AANA committees fosters networking and camaraderie among colleagues. You will build connections with fellow CRNAs from across the country that not only expands your professional network but also cultivates lasting friendships and support systems. Serving on AANA national committees offers a fulfilling and enriching experience, combining professional growth, advocacy, networking, and leadership development."

Dee Bender, DNAP, CRNA, MNNA

Mission: The State Organizational Development Committee (SODC) is a standing committee that reviews applications for funding from the Organizational Health Allocations and Strategic Reserve Fund and makes recommendations to the Board of Directors for a final decision on funding requests. The committee also works in conjunction with the directors to assist state associations with organizational development issues and makes recommendations to the Board of Directors on revisions to the Guidelines for State Organizational Health.

Mission: Formed in 2019, this ad hoc committee designs and implements initiatives, educational opportunities, and events that foster cultural sensitivity, diversity, and inclusion for the nurse anesthesia profession.

Recognizing that its members represent all demographics and practice in every setting in which anesthesia is delivered across the United States, AANA desires to integrate diversity and inclusion into the work of its Board, committees, and staff.

*In FY25 the Health and Wellness Committee will transition into the Wellness Committee. The Wellness Committee is a special committee that assists the Board of Directors regarding matters related to fostering lifelong healthy behaviors and decisions, provider well-being, and the occupational risk of substance use disorder.

Mission: The Health and Wellness Committee is a special committee that assists the Board of Directors in fostering lifelong healthy behavior decisions for AANA members.

Mission: The Bylaws and Resolutions Committee is an elected, standing committee that reviews proposed amendments to the AANA bylaws, resolutions, and rules and submits them for consideration to AANA members at the Annual Congress and submits emergency resolutions throughout the year as needed.

Mission: The AANA Journal Editorial Panel is responsible for accepting, reviewing, and editing papers submitted for publication in the AANA Journal. The panel also oversees the Writers Workshop.

(Note: The Journal Editorial Panel is not part of the committee application process.)
